com.esri.mo2.cs.geom
Class Vector2D

java.lang.Object
  |
  +--com.esri.mo2.cs.geom.Vector2D
Direct Known Subclasses:
UnitVector2D
public class Vector2D
extends Object

This class implements a vector with a X component and Y component. It is used in coordinate geometry.

See Also:
UnitVector2D, Cogo

Field Summary
 double x
          The x component of the 2D vector with a default value of 0.0.
 double y
          The y component of the 2D vector with a default value of 0.0.
 
Constructor Summary
Vector2D()
          Constructs a vector with x=0.0 and y=0.0.
Vector2D(double dx, double dy)
          Constructs a vector from the delta-x and delta-y components.
Vector2D(Point start, Point end)
          Constructs a vector from the two points.

          Computes the angle of the vector (in radians).

          Computes the dot product of the current vector and the specified vector.

dot

public final double dot(Vector2D vec)
Computes the dot product of the current vector and the specified vector.

Parameters:
vec - the vector with which to compute the dot product.
Returns:
the dot product (which represents the component of vec in the direction of "this" vector).

Parameters:

Returns:
the dot product (which represents the component of vec in the direction of "this" vector).

dot

public static final double dot(double vx,
                               double vy,
                               double vecx,
                               double vecy)
Computes the dot product of one vector v and the specified vector vec.

Parameters:
vx - the x component of the vector v.
vy - the y component of the vector v.
vecx - the x component of the vector with which to compute the dot product.
vecy - the y component of the vector with which to compute the dot product.
Returns:
the dot product (which represents the component of vec in the direction of vector v).

angle

public final double angle()
Computes the angle of the vector (in radians). The angle is "swung" counter clockwise from 3 o'clock.

Returns:
the angle

turnClockwise90

public final void turnClockwise90()
Changes the direction of this vector by turning it 90 degrees clockwise (or right).
